newsitem.title: UK: Russian Urals crude sells lower at Dtd -$1.30 - traders.
newsitem.headline: Russian Urals crude sells lower at Dtd -$1.30 - traders.

text.p: Russian Urals crude sold sharply lower in the Mediterranean at a $1.30 discount to international benchmark Dated Brent blend on Wednesday, traders said.
The price agreed for the 80,000 tonne March 28/29 loader heading to an eastern Mediterranean destination was around 25 cents lower than the previously reported level, they said.

In another sign of market weakness, an 80,000 tonne Urals loading March 22/24 and also heading to the east Mediterranean changed hands at dated -$1.15 CIF, traders said. A third Urals also traded at dated -$1.15 CIF but the destination was not immediately known.
In nothern Europe, a cargo of Urals due to load March 18/20 was sold at Dated -90 cents CIF.
The trades confirmed talk earlier that the market value of the grade was substantially lower than previously reported deals.
Much of the activity has been conducted on a private and confidential basis by sellers anxious to shore up maximum value in a crumbling market.
Despite Wednesday's sales traders said they saw at least five million barrels of Urals unsold for March. Two Urals were done late last week and early this week at Dated -$1.05 and -$1.03.
